alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Johnston (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 11 at 6:26PM CDT until April 11 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Johnston County in southeastern Oklahoma... Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... Northern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 715 PM CDT. * At 625 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 4 miles north of Stringtown to near Olney to near Bromide, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Atoka, Coalgate, Wapanucka, Stringtown, Lehigh, Bromide, Centrahoma, Clarita, Olney, Connerville, Wardville, Daisy, Phillips, Atoka Reservoir, Chockie, Redden and northern McGee Creek Lake. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
